byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma reported from Kathmandu, and Nida Najar from New Delhi.
byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Agreement reached between four major Nepalese political parties to split nation into six provinces is met by protests across country; lack of division has been obstacle to creating new constitution for Nepal.
lead_paragraph: Two people were killed and six wounded in clashes with the police over a proposal linked to the drafting of a new constitution.

headline.main: Plan to Redraw Internal Districts in Nepal Prompts Violent Protest
headline.print_headline: Plan to Redraw Districts Prompts Clashes in Nepal

snippet: Two people were killed and six wounded in clashes with the police over a proposal linked to the drafting of a new constitution.
